intro: Didymanthus incana, commonly known as the hairy didymanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Didymanthus incana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
